prize.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: something that is given to someone who is successful in a competition, race, game of chance etc
prize.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: In this month’s competition you could win a prize worth £3,000.
The first prize has gone to Dr John Gentle.
Scientists from Oxford shared the Nobel Prize for Medicine in 1945.
The prizes are awarded  (=given) every year to students who have shown original thinking in their work.
The prize for best photography has been won by a young Dutch photographer.
prize.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: something that is very valuable to you or that it is very important to have
prize.translation[0].note_box[0].section: She won the Nobel Prize for literature in 1938.
Ms Brolls also took the prize for best individual speaker.
If your letter is published, you will receive a £5 prize.
They will share the first prize of £500.
A prize will be given for the best-decorated egg.
Four years later he was awarded the Erasmus Prize.
The fiction prize goes to Carol Shields.
She won first prize in a poetry competition.
The film won the top prize at the Berlin Film Festival.
The runner-up will get a consolation prize of a camera.
The cake I made for the competition was so bad I got the booby prize.
There's a $5,000 cash prize for the winner.
Congratulations to all the prize winners!
The players are demanding an increase in prize money.
He won the car in a prize draw.
prize.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to think that someone or something is very important or valuable
prize.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: He is someone who prizes truth and decency above all things.
The company’s shoes are highly prized by fashion conscious youngsters.
prize.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: good enough to win a prize or having won a prize
prize.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: He has spent months cultivating what he hopes are prize flowers.
prize.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: The Picasso painting is a prize exhibit in the museum.
prize.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: something that is very valuable or important to have
prize.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: With a portfolio of $1 billion, Amerco is an attractive prize.
The administration has worked behind the scenes to help Turkey win the big prize — EU membership.
prize.translation[4].definitions[0].defi: the best, most valuable or important
prize.translation[4].definitions[0].exam: In recent weeks, a number ofprize assets have been sold.
